myopenmath.statement:
A coffee distributor plans to mix some Ethiopian coffee that sells for \displaystyle\${9.10} per pound with some Kona coffee that sells for \displaystyle\${14.70} per pound to create \displaystyle{100} pounds of a new coffee blend that will sell for \displaystyle\${13.52} per pound.
How many pounds of each kind of coffee should they mix? Round to the nearest pound. pounds of Ethiopian coffee. pounds of Kona coffee.
